question: You're going home... it's off... for the time being at least.
answer: Bullshit! I want him. I want that son of a bitch Carlos! And I want him dead!

question: Tough shit what you want, Annibal. Koj had a ticket for Libya on him. Chances are he wasn't looking for you but...
answer: He wasn't looking for me... He thought I was Carlos!

question: That's what I think too but the Director wants an operation review board... The DST shoot out... the girl winds up dead in Paris... now this... I've got to go back for the review and you've got to go home.
answer: No way man... it was my fault... the whole thing... I want him dead!

question: What do you mean it was your fault?
answer: When he asked me about the paper... if I coulda just bullshitted my way...

question: It was a password... you didn't know it... anything you would have tried would have backfired. I had a thing like that... Awfully warm for this time of year... the response was, yes but not as sticky as two summers ago... the guy says anything else... he even hesitates, you shoot him. I shot him... There was nothing else you could have done.
answer: I'm not leavin' till we get him.

question: Nobody's askin' you. They're shuttin' us down. You go back home... maybe I'll see you again... maybe I won't. You'll either hear from me or you'll get new sea duty and that's the end of it.
answer: Just like that?

question: Just like that. I ain't the Madam kid... I'm just one of the whores. And so are you.
answer: What's wrong?

question: What's wrong?
answer: You've been with another woman... haven't you.

question: What are you talking about?
answer: Haven't you?

question: No. What... what would make you say a thing like that?
answer: You're different...

question: Maura... I was on a submarine... there aren't any women on submarines... There was nothin' to do but read. They had one of those... how to improve your sex life books... I must have read it about ten times. I tried out a couple of things from chapter three okay? I mean if it didn't turn you on blame Doctor Ruth okay?
answer: Okay.

question: Great. You want to check with the Navy to see if we had shore leave... I'll get you a fuckin' letter okay?
answer: I don't need any letters. And I don't need you to talk to me like that either. Where are you going?

question: Get somethin' to eat... I'm starving. Maura... Maura!
answer: What?

question: Where's the car? The car's not in the garage. Where's the car?
answer: The fellow at the service station said it needed a tune up. I took it in this morning... You didn't say you were going to need it.

question: Don't do that anymore.
answer: What?

question: I don't want anybody workin' on the car. Car needs something I'll do it. But I don't want anybody touchin' that car.
answer: Why? What difference does it make.

question: It makes a difference to me okay? So don't do it.
answer: Did you check the mail?

question: Yeah I checked the mail. Still nothin' from the Navy. Why, you so anxious to get rid of me?
answer: I don't want you goin' back to those subs. I'll tell you that.

question: Yeah well I don't have much to say about it. It's the Navy you know.
answer: You can request another assignment. It's changed you Annibal. It's hurting us.

question: What's hurting us?
answer: Your attitude... that's what hurting us.

question: My attitude. I don't have an attitude man... you got an attitude.
answer: You're suspicious of everything that goes on... you snap at Joey, you snap at me. I don't like it.

question: Look I just... it's hard gettin' used to... you know... it's hard... Listen... tomorrow's Joey's game. Let's just go to Joey's game. It'll be nice. It'll be like it always was. You'll see. Okay... remember, what do we do?
answer: Keep my eye on the ball.

question: And who's the guy who wins?
answer: Whoever has fun, wins.

question: Right! So you go out there and have fun.
answer: I don't want so see you out there dickin' around today, you understand? You're gonna be focused and aggressive and you're gonna play to win. Got it? Hey, you think I'm talking just to hear myself talk? Look at me when I'm talking to you!

question: Hey pal, lighten up, what do you say? It's just a game?
answer: What did you say?

question: I said lighten up. It's just a game and he's just a kid.
answer: He's my kid.

question: Great. So why don't we let our kids have a good time. Come on, I'll buy you a beer.
answer: I don't need you to buy me a fuckin' beer, you piece of shit. And you stick your face in my business again and I'll beat the living fuck out of you. What do you say to that?

question: Little League, huh? Tough game.
answer: What are you doing here?

question: It's show time.
answer: I got to have time to think it over.

question: There isn't any time. He's on his way to East Berlin. We have word he's planning another attack in Europe. He'll be there maybe four days at the most.
answer: Hey, I don't know what to do anymore, okay? I almost killed some little kid's father today. I don't know about anything anymore.

question: Hey, he was a baseball dad. He deserved it. Besides, from what I heard his kid was out, so what's the beef?
answer: I don't know if I could come back from it again.

question: What happened to I want the son of a bitch dead? You think Carlos has had a change of heart and turned nice all of a sudden?
answer: Don't tell me about Carlos, Jack. I know exactly who Carlos is. I know a hell of a lot better than you do. But, maybe there's more important things to me, like keepin' from goin' crazy... like gettin' back to bein' me instead of me bein' some kind of fuckin' maniac.

question: You want to get back to bein' you? Then finish it. Kill him. Kill him and he's dead and it's over with. You walk away from it now and what do you think you're gonna be like the next time you read that that son of a bitch blew up some airplane full of women and kids.
answer: Hey, the guy deserves to be dead. I know that.

question: This isn't abstract, Annibal. You're walkin' around with his face. Sooner or later one of the bad guys is gonna see it like Koj did, and next time Amos won't be there to take the bullet for you. Carlos doesn't forget. You help me get him or you're never gonna know when he's comin' after you... Listen to me kid. I don't have any friends, no family, no nothin'. The only relationships I ever had that mattered to me were with the people I killed. But I... I fucking created you! You can't just walk away now.
answer: You did create me, didn't you... From the beginning... that kid in the hospital in Bethesda... when I was supposed to be the doctor... It was all bullshit, wasn't it? All an act...

question: With my job!? What do you think my job is, Maura... huh? What do you think is out there? A nice, pretty safe little world with shopping malls and little league and ballet lessons. You sit here in your little kitchen and cook your little meals... People are killing people out there! Jackals are licking up their blood waiting for the next corpse to drop... and I'm one of them. You get that? Do you get that now?! I've murdered people. Not safe and clean and surgical firing a missile from some ship, but close and with my hands so their blood splattered on me... so their brains splattered on me. And they weren't the enemy, Maura... they were Allies. They were on our side. It was just to keep a cover... I've betrayed everything I ever believed in. I've betrayed you... I've fucked other women... I've killed men... There was a woman I would have killed but I just ran out of time. I've let friends die... I've become a terrorist... and I've made you and the children a target. Do you understand what I'm saying to you? Do you see me now? Do you see the monster? There's another one worse than me and he is out there and he will kill you and the children if I don't kill him first... . That's my job, Maura. And if you don't mind, I'm late for work.
answer: We used a double agent to get word to the Russians that Carlos is really here to close his deal with us and not to plan a new attack in Europe. He has a new girlfriend... He's been fucking her brains out since he got here. He has her brought over every night in a limo. You'll be dropped near the mansion... as soon as she goes in, you make as if you're sneaking out... the Russians will be watching. You'll go to the meet. It's at that beer hall, there... see? You see it?

question: Got it.
answer: You go to the meet at the beer hall. Play it out... let 'em take your picture... then you've got to get back. They're going to have to analyze the pictures and see through your disguise before they can authorize a hit. They won't be able to do that before you're able to get back to the mansion. At twenty-one fifteen a Volga with diplomatic plates, DC- four-five-nine-two will come by the northeast corner of the compound. It will slow down... you jump in. If you can't make it for any reason, there will be another run at exactly twenty-one forty-five. It's your only ticket out so don't be late.

question: Who do I meet? Who's my contact?
answer: Me... My ass is on the line too.

question: Who cares? This isn't you and me. It's me and him. If the Russians don't go for the bait for any reason...
answer: If the Russians don't go for the bait for any reason you will have gotten out of there at twenty-one fifteen per orders.

question: Don't even think about it. It would deprive the KGB of the pleasure of interrogating you.
answer: KGB? I thought...

question: What? That we were your new friends... The CIA... Jack Shaw...
answer: Jack Shaw...?

question: Stop playing games. And it's no use looking behind me... Your associates can no longer be of assistance. Not to you, not to anyone...
answer: Comrade, you'd getter have an explanation --

question: You've got it all wrong, Illich. It's you who has all the explaining to do... Now get dressed! You too, Fraulein.
answer: My pants... That's what was going on in Libya. The CIA... The DST... They're trying to set me up and you're falling for it, you idiot!

question: Enough. We tailed you to your meeting. We have the pictures of you with Shaw.
answer: That's impossible. I've been here all night. Ask her. Tell him.

question: We know about your women... Now hurry up, both of you!
answer: I'll prove it to you. You'll be pleading for my forgiveness. Let's just go. I want to be interrogated. I demand to be interrogated.

question: Let's get the fuck out of here. Have you come looking for me now, Annibal? Awfully warm for this time of year isn't it?
answer: Any word?

question: How you feeling?
answer: Did he get away? Then it was all for nothing... the whole thing.

question: No it wasn't. He's finished. The KGB bought it. As far as they're concerned, he's the enemy now. He'll bounce around from one country to the next. But his paymasters have disowned him. None of their client states will risk using him. No one'll trust him again. He'll spend the rest of his life looking over his shoulder waiting to be betrayed. And it'll happen... sooner or later... when it's to some country's advantage... they'll give him up or they'll trade him. He's finished. It worked and he's finished.
answer: Not for me he isn't... There are still two of us...

question: Not for me he isn't... There are still two of us...
answer: Is it over?

question: No. You have to make a new life for yourself and the children.
answer: No.

question: Maura, anytime I start a car I'll wonder if this is the one that explodes. I couldn't bear the thought of you and the children being in that danger. He'll want me and everyone I've ever loved to be dead. Trust me... I know how he thinks because it's the way I think now too. I am so... sorry. I am so sorry...
answer: I won't leave you.

question: Maura, when my father was put into prison he told my mother to take me and leave and start a new life. That's what you've got to do.
answer: You're not in prison and I'm not your mother and I won't leave you. I will not let him do this to us. Not him... not the CIA... not anyone.

question: He'll come after me.
answer: Get me a gun and teach me to shoot and he'll have to deal with both of us. This animal will not destroy my family. Please... come home.
